TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebHttpBehavior extends System.Object implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior

Docs.summary: Enables the Web programming model for a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior> behavior, when used in conjunction with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> binding, enables [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to expose and access Web style services. <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost> automatically adds this behavior to endpoints that use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.

MemberSignature.Value: public WebHttpBehavior ();

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: The binding parameters that support modifying the bindings.
Docs.summary: Implements the method to pass data at runtime to bindings to support custom behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ApplyClientBehavior (System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint, System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime clientRuntime);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyClientBehavior(class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint, class System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime clientRuntime) cil managed

Docs.param: The endpoint that exposes the contract.
The client to which the custom behavior is applied.
Docs.summary: Implements the method to support modification or extension of the client across an endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks As part of this method, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetRequestClientFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetReplyClientFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> are called for each operation to determine the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> to install.

Docs.param: The endpoint that exposes the contract.
The endpoint dispatcher to which the behavior is applied.
Docs.summary: Implements the method to support modification or extension of the client across an endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks As part of this method, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetRequestDispatchFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetReplyDispatchFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> are called for each operation to determine the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter> to install.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle DefaultBodyStyle { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle DefaultBodyStyle

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the default message body style.
Docs.value: One of the values defined in the enumeration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> does not explicitly set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.BodyStyle%2A> property, the value of this property is used as the body style for the operation. The default value is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.Bare>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat DefaultOutgoingRequestFormat { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat DefaultOutgoingRequestFormat

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the default outgoing request format.
Docs.value: One of the values defined in the enumeration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> does not explicitly set the `OutgoingRequestFormat` property, the value of this property is used as the request format for the operation. The default value is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat.Xml>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat DefaultOutgoingResponseFormat { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat DefaultOutgoingResponseFormat

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the default outgoing response format.
Docs.value: One of the values defined in the enumeration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> does not explicitly set the `OutgoingResponseFormat` property, the value of this property is used as the response format for the operation. The default value is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat.Xml>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector GetOperationSelector (System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector GetOperationSelector(class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint) cil managed

Docs.param: The endpoint that exposes the contract.
Docs.summary: Creates a new object.
Docs.returns: An instance of that contains the operation selector for the specified endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector> maps calls to [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service operations based on the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) suffix and the HTTP method used. This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector> that maps the incoming HTTP request to a service operation.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.QueryStringConverter GetQueryStringConverter (System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.QueryStringConverter GetQueryStringConverter(class System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the query string converter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.QueryStringConverter> that can convert the service operation parameter types to and from the HTTP request URL's query string.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter GetReplyClientFormatter (System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter GetReplyClientFormatter(class System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the reply formatter on the client for the specified endpoint and service operation.
Docs.returns: An reference to the reply formatter on the client for the specified operation and endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> that is called to deserialize the response message into the out parameters/return value of the service operation.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter GetReplyDispatchFormatter (System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter GetReplyDispatchFormatter(class System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the reply formatter on the service for the specified endpoint and service operation.
Docs.returns: An reference to the reply formatter on the service for the specified operation and endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter> that is called to convert the return value/out parameters of the service operation to a response message.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter GetRequestClientFormatter (System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter GetRequestClientFormatter(class System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the request formatter on the client for the specified service operation and endpoint.
Docs.returns: An reference to the request formatter on the client for the specified operation and endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> that is called to convert the input parameters of the service operation call to a request message. Parameters specified in the <xref:System.UriTemplate> of the service operation must be serialized to the `To` URI of the request message and other parameters must be serialized to the body of the request message.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter GetRequestDispatchFormatter (System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter GetRequestDispatchFormatter(class System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription operationDescription, class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the request formatter on the service for the given service operation and service endpoint.
Docs.returns: An reference to the request formatter on the service for the specified operation and endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter> that is called to deserialize the input parameters of the service operation from the request message. Parameters specified in the <xref:System.UriTemplate> of the service operation must be deserialized from the `To` URI of the request message and other parameters must be deserialized from the body of the request message.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool HelpEnabled { get; set; }
.property instance bool HelpEnabled

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] Help page is enabled.
Docs.value: if the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)]Help page is enabled; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] REST Help page, see [WCF Web HTTP Service Help Page](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-web-http-service-help-page.md).
To enable the helpEnabled attribute in a configuration file:
```
<system.serviceModel> <behaviors> <endpointBehaviors> <behavior name="MyEndpointBehavior"> <webHttp helpEnabled="true" /> </behavior> </endpointBehaviors> </system.serviceModel>
```
To programmatically enable the HelpEnabled property:
```
WebHttpBehavior helpBehavior = new WebHttpBehavior(); helpBehavior.HelpEnabled = true; host.Description.Endpoints[0].Behaviors.Add(helpBehavior);
```

MemberSignature.Value: protected string JavascriptCallbackParameterName { get; set; }
.property instance string JavascriptCallbackParameterName

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript callback parameter name.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Validate (System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Validate(class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Confirms that the endpoint meets the requirements for the Web programming model.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Verifies the following:
- The endpoint is not `null`.
- The endpoint uses the HTTP or HTTPS schemes.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> of the binding is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.None%2A>.
- The binding contains an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement> where <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.ManualAddressing%2A> is set to `true`.
- The parameters specified in the <xref:System.UriTemplate> must be part of the operation.
- Operations that specify <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.Bare> have, at most, one input parameter and can have no out parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void ValidateBinding (System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ValidateBinding(class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Ensures the binding is valid for use with the WCF Web Programming Model.
